attributes.action: Cap diesel and petrol prices when companies are reaping billions of profit.
attributes.additional_details:
Because they can reasses the tax on fuel and can also put protections in place for the public against the private fuel companies. 

Historically the price of crude has matched what it is today and it was 1.17 pet litre there is no reason it should be at the level it is at today.
attributes.background: Reduce tax on fuel and cap the price of fuel when companies gain huge profits. The current pricing levels are making it unaffordable for the avg working person.

rejection.details:
The price charged for fuel is a commercial matter for retailers, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

You may wish to sign these petitions which call for related actions: 

'Reduce fuel duty and VAT by 40% for a period of 2 years': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599089

'Stop charging VAT on fuel duty': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599411

'Temporarily suspend all taxes on all fuels and energy bills': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610585
